item.title: Back End
item.description: Back End Side of development that responsible for server-side of the application.

item.title: Front End
item.description: Front End Side of development that responsible for client-side or UI of the application.

item.title: Browser Object Model
item.description: Browser Object Model BOM is a browser’s API interfaces Additional objects, provided by browser to work with everything, except document Examples Window.navigator (MDN Web Docs)

item.title: Document Object Model
item.description: Document Object Model DOM is a programming interface for HTML and XML documents. Links Introduction to the DOM (MDN Web Docs)

item.title: HTML
item.description: HTML HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is a markup language for document that are displayed in the browser. It is not a programming language btw

item.title: Server Side Rendering
item.description: Server Side Rendering Server Side Rendering is a process when your files (for example, HTML and CSS files) are rendering by server side instead of client side Links Rendering on the Web (developers.google.com)
